Class Fleximage::ImageProxy
In: lib/fleximage/image_proxy.rb
Parent: Object

An instance of this class is yielded when Model#operate is called. It enables image operators to be called to transform the image. You should never need to directly deal with this class. You simply call image operators on this object when inside an Model#operate block 

  @photo.operate do |image|
    image.resize '640x480'
  end

In this example, image is an instance of ImageProxy

Methods

method_missing   new  

Attributes

image  [RW]  The image to be manipulated by operators.

Public Class methods

new(image, model_obj)

Create a new image operator proxy.

Public Instance methods

method_missing(method_name, *args)

A call to an unknown method will look for an Operator by that method‘s name. If it finds one, it will execute that operator.

[Source]

    # File lib/fleximage/image_proxy.rb, line 28
28:     def method_missing(method_name, *args)
29:       # Find the operator class
30:       class_name = method_name.to_s.camelcase
31:       operator_class = "Fleximage::Operator::#{class_name}".constantize
32:       
33:       # Define a method for this operator so future calls to this operation are faster
34:       self.class.module_eval "def \#{method_name}(*args)\n@image = execute_operator(\#{operator_class}, *args)\nend\n"
35:       
36:       # Call the method that was just defined to perform its functionality.
37:       send(method_name, *args)
38:     
39:     rescue NameError => e
40:       if e.to_s =~ /uninitialized constant Fleximage::Operator::#{class_name}/
41:         raise OperatorNotFound, "No operator Fleximage::Operator::#{class_name} found for the method \"#{method_name}\""
42:       else
43:         raise e
44:       end
45:     end

[Validate]
